event.title: 2006 the population of Gol Gol increased

data.event: In the ten years to 2006 the population of Gol Gol increased from 619 to 663, an average annual increase of 0.71%.

event.title: 17 March 1836, the surveyor Thomas Livingston Mitchell set out

data.event: On 17 March 1836, the surveyor Thomas Livingston Mitchell set out on an expedition from Boree Station (west of Orange) with 25 men, 2 boats, a train of bullock carts and a herd of at least 100 cattle, which were to be used for food when wild animals were scarce.

event.title: the future village the local Aboriginals informed Mitchell that the area next to the Murray River was called

data.event: On his arrival at the site of the future village the local Aboriginals informed Mitchell that the area next to the Murray River was called Gol Gol (meaning meeting place).

event.title: returned to his base camp on the 4 June 1836

data.event: When Mitchell returned to his base camp on the 4 June 1836 he passed on the name of Gol Gol to his superiors.
